com.panviva.util.pgc.dom.processing

Interface IPartitioner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentPartitioner, FolderPartitioner, Partitioner, SectionPartitioner, TaskPartitioner

    public interface IPartitioner
    Author:
    jcharles This interface defines all the methods to partition a document.

    • Method Summary

      • setParentContainerXPath

        void setParentContainerXPath(java.lang.String sPath)
        This method provides the xPath to the node or nodes the content of which will be used for partitioning. Folder partitioning is applied to siblings of this node. For Document/Section/Task/etc. partitioning, this method provides the xPath to a node or nodes whose children will be used for partitioning.
        Parameters:
        sPath - Parent container XPath

      • getParentContainerXPath

        java.lang.String getParentContainerXPath()
        This method returns the parent container XPath string.
        Returns:
        String Parent container XPath string.

      • setDocumentRootXPath

        void setDocumentRootXPath(java.lang.String sPath)
        This method sets the XPath to the starting element used to partition a document for the highest level of partitioning. If folder partitioning is used, the Parent Container XPath should be the same as this. If folder level partitioning is not used, the devolution condition of REALIGN_TO_ROOT_CONTAINER should enforce the next highest level of partitioning to realign its starting point (Parent Container XPath) to be the same as the Document Root XPath. This is handled by the Transformation Manager.
        Parameters:
        sPath - Document root XPath

      • getDocumentRootXPath

        java.lang.String getDocumentRootXPath()
        Returns the starting element XPath for the highest level of partitioning.
        Returns:
        String Document root XPath

      • getParentContainerNodes

        org.w3c.dom.NodeList getParentContainerNodes()
                                      throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        This method returns a node or nodes whose siblings for folder partitioning or children for document/section/task partitioning will be used to further partition a document.
        Returns:
        NodeList List of nodes whose siblings for folder partitioning or children for document/section/task partitioning will be used to further partition a document.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException - Thrown if an invalid XPath is used

      • setParentContainerType

        void setParentContainerType(IPartitionType type)
        This method sets the type of parent container. The parent container determines whether sibling (for folders) or child nodes (for document/section/tasks) are used to further partition a document.
        Parameters:
        type - Parent Container Type

      • getParentContainerType

        IPartitionType getParentContainerType()
        This method retrieves the type of parent container.
        Returns:
        IPartitionType Parent Container Type implementation instance

      • setIntroPartitionTitle

        void setIntroPartitionTitle(java.lang.String title)
        This method sets the title for the introductory partition. This partition captures all elements that are before the first matching partition element in the document.
        Parameters:
        title - Introductory partition title

      • getIntroPartitionTitle

        java.lang.String getIntroPartitionTitle()
        Returns:
        String The introductory partition title.

      • setKeepFirstElements

        void setKeepFirstElements(boolean bool)
        This method sets a flag to indicate the first non-matching elements should or should not be included in an introductory partition.
        Parameters:
        bool - Flag to indicate first elements will be preserved

      • getKeepFirstElements

        boolean getKeepFirstElements()
        This method returns a flag to indicate the first non-matching elements should or should not be included in an introductory partition.
        Returns:
        boolean Flag to indicate first elements will be preserved

      • getPartitionType

        PartitionType getPartitionType()
        This method returns the type of partition i.e. Folder, Document, Section, Task, ...
        Returns:
        PartitionType Partition type implementation instance

      • getTargetType

        RuleTargetType getTargetType()
        This method returns the target type of partition i.e. Procedure, Policy, Process, External
        Returns:
        RuleTargetType Rule target type

      • setTargetType

        void setTargetType(RuleTargetType targetType)
        This method sets the target type of partition. Used only for documents at this stage.
        Parameters:
        targetType - Rule target type

        java.lang.String getTargetTypeAsString()
        Returns:
        String Returns the Target Type as a Camel Notation String.

      • partition

        void partition()
        throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        Do the partitioning of the document.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException - Thrown if an invalid XPath is used during the partition process

      • setLastFolderId

        void setLastFolderId(int id)
        Set the last folder partition id. Folders are partitioned first documents next. Document ids start at last folder id + 1.
        Parameters:
        id - Last Folder id

      • getLastFolderId

        int getLastFolderId()
        Retrieve the last folder partition id.
        Returns:
        int Last Folder id
